dataList.content: ... Heard you managed to come out on top in your first sparring match. Congrats.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Thanks... I gotta admit, your classes are definitely coming in handy.
I like your attitude. Well, shall we take a look at what I prepared for today?

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: You're teaching about exploring... huh? It's going to be an indoors class?
Yep. Exploring. Where should I begin? It's a very big subject.
Free soloing to the top of the highest building in Hongyuan... Surviving ten days in Hongyuan Backstreets with only three items... I had plenty of ideas, but most of them got denied.
... And rightly so.
And that's when I realized...
... that exploring isn't always limited to adventures in the physical space.
A few weeks ago...
So I'm just here to fill in, since this game needs a certain number of players, but...
Really? Can you really call this tabletop game an "adventure"...?
Yet, in games of make-believe, any simulacra can be made as real as— Ahh, what a move...!
Ooh, nice... I'm gonna roll for damage.
Gah! Young Ishmael, thou hast absolutely pummeled the gorgon beast with thy fireball spell, rendering it most crispy.
It was a formidable foe... that was wonderfully executed, Miss Ishmael.
Huh, r-really?
Well, then... as my next move...

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: And that's how you... came up with this?
I've played a few other games, but... this is new for me, too. I'm still pretty new in general, I guess...
This is called "Jianghu Journeys"(江湖遊覽記), or J&J. It's a popular game among Hongyuan's youths. It's gotten generally positive reviews, too.
What Ishmael so proudly presented before everyone appeared to be... a board game with numerous cards and mini figures.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: ... Okay. What do these huge piles of papers have to do with exploration?
Rule number one.
The most experienced player among those gathered becomes the JM.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: ... The JM?

Yeah, Journey Master. The Journey Master designs the story around the players' choices, sets the stage for what happens next, and generally helps guide the explorers to safely arrive at their goals. That's why the most experienced player takes that role.
Which would be me.
WIS... STR... DEX... each character seems to have these things called "stats". Ah, looks like we just have to pick from a set of pre-made characters for this one.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: So... I'm supposed to be playing this character's role?
Sinclair and Jia Xichun picked up their cards with confusion clear in their eyes.

You arrive at the great city of <ruby=Smoke-cloud>Yanyun</ruby>, a place known to be the gathering hub for all kinds of influential people. You traveled here in search of a... um... a legendary treasure, called, uh... yeah, <ruby=The Sword of Farland>The Tianya Sword (天涯劍)</ruby>.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: The City of Yanyun, huh... cool. So why are we looking for that sword again?
Whew, uh... it's because, uh...

So there's this legend in Yanyun about how... The Sword of... right, the Tianya Sword is the only way to quell the chaos of these lands and bring peace to its people. And... also, about how having that sword is the proof of the true leader of these lands... and so on and so forth, you know.
Ishmael was stuttering and stammering through the introduction without her usual confidence.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: I see... This city called Yanyun must be in a lot of trouble, too.
Seemingly affected by the oddly familiar setting of the story, Jia Xichun nodded solemnly without noticing Ishmael stumbling through the introduction.
W-well, you know how it is. The point is, you guys need to go find that sword.

dataList.title: The Hierarch of Hongyuan
dataList.content: Then... I will claim the Tianya Sword, no matter what it costs me.
Jia Xichun nods with determination.
